'''Kaitlyn Adrianna Baker'''<ref name="ISWC"/> (born November 23, 1994){{citation needed|date=February 2020}} is an American [[Country music|country]] singer and songwriter.

==Early life==
Kaitlyn Adrianna Baker was born and raised in [[Pound, Virginia]].<ref name="ISWC"/> Her father, grandfather and other family members worked in coal mines. ''[[Virginia Living]]'' magazine referred to her as a new "coal miner's daughter."<ref>{{cite web|author=Tennis, Joe|title=Coal Miner's Daughter|url=http://www.virginialiving.com/coal-miner's-daughter/|website=VirginiaLiving.com|date=May 5, 2014 |accessdate=May 5, 2014}}</ref> Baker started singing in church and then professionally as a young girl at events in her area.<ref>{{cite web|author=Dauphin, Chuck|title=615 Spotlight: Kaitlyn Baker and her debut single 'Burn'|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-615/6133939/kaitlyn-baker-burn|website=Billboard.com|accessdate=June 25, 2014}}</ref>

==Career==
Baker's debut single, "Burn", reached number fifty four on the ''[[MusicRow]]'' Breakout Chart in 2015, and inspired the creation of Kaitlyn Baker's BURN Sauce, a hot sauce produced by Pepper Palace in [[Sevierville, Tennessee]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Country artist Kaitlyn Baker to perform free show Saturday|url=http://www.knoxnews.com/entertainment/music/country-artist-kaitlyn-baker-to-perform-free-show-saturday-ep-693128175-354086441.html|website=KnoxNews.com|accessdate=October 23, 2014}}</ref> Baker has said that the song, which is about a woman who gets revenge on her cheating husband, was loosely based on something that happened to her grandmother.<ref>{{cite web|author=Thompson, Gayle|title=Singer-Songwriter Kaitlyn Baker Releases New Single, Burn'|url=http://theboot.com/kaitlyn-baker-burn/|website=TheBoot.com|date=July 9, 2014 |accessdate=July 9, 2014}}</ref>

In March 2015, her ballad, "Coal Train", was included on the 2015 ACM Awards ZinePak, a 2-CD album released by the [[Academy of Country Music]] and distributed exclusively through [[Walmart]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Harr, Dan|title=ACM Attention Prompts Early Release of Kaitlyn Baker's 'Coal Train'|url=http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/acm-attention-prompts-early-release-of-kaitlyn-bakers-coal-train/|website=MusicNewsNashville.com|accessdate=April 28, 2015}}</ref>  The album debuted at number four on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' Country Albums chart.<ref>{{cite web|title=Billboard chart roundup|url=http://forthecountryrecord.com/2015/04/16/billboard-chart-roundup-week-of-april-25th-2015/|website=ForTheCountryRecord.com|accessdate=April 25, 2015}}</ref>

In November 2015, Baker released a cover of the classic Christmas song "[[Rockin' Around the Christmas Tree]]" in association with The Mansion Entertainment, a Nashville-based record label.<ref>{{cite web|author=Westover, Jeff|title=Kaitlyn Baker is Rockin' Around the Christmas Tree|url=http://mymerrychristmas.com/kaitlyn-baker-is-rockin-around-the-christmas-tree/|website=MyMerryChristmas.com|date=November 15, 2015 |accessdate=November 15, 2015}}</ref>

In June 2016, she released "Heart of Appalachia," a song about her native Southwest Virginia. In a review, music critic Tom Netherland wrote, "Southwest Virginia glows in Baker's song."<ref>{{cite web|author=Netherland, Tom|title=Kaitlyn Baker has a 'Heart of Appalachia'|url=http://www.heraldcourier.com/community/kaitlyn-baker-has-a-heart-of-appalachia/article_cffeb7fc-2f38-11e6-9e33-97b5b768b1d6.html|website=HeraldCourier.com|date=June 12, 2016 |accessdate=June 12, 2016}}</ref>   "Heart of Appalachia" was designated the official theme song of the Heart of Appalachia Tourism Authority, a nonprofit organization that promotes tourism in the region. An accompanying music video included cameo appearances by prominent bluegrass artists Ralph Stanley II and [[Larry Cordle]]. Cordle co-produced and sang background vocals on the record. Songwriter and musician Scott Arnold, who wrote the song with Baker, produced the music tracks.<ref>{{cite web|title=Heart of Appalachia Tourism Authority gets its own theme song|url=http://www.virginiabusiness.com/news/article/heart-of-appalachia-tourism-authority-gets-its-own-theme-song|website=VirginiaBusiness.com|accessdate=June 13, 2016}}</ref>

In September 2016, Baker released her single "To Pieces" to country radio.<ref>{{cite web|author=Holland, Angie|title=Country singer Kaitlyn Baker is feelin' it |url=http://www.oskaloosa.com/news/local_news/country-singer-kaitlyn-baker-is-feelin-it/article_9c9f24ee-94bb-11e6-893b-4b7e64b202b2.html|website=Oskaloosa.com|date=October 17, 2016 |accessdate=October 17, 2016}}</ref> An accompanying music video premiered on The [[Heartland (TV network)|Heartland]] Network, a national cable and satellite television channel.<ref>{{cite web|author=Wright, John|title=Miller joins with Virginia singer to produce country radio single |url=http://m.murrayledger.com/mobile/news/miller-joins-with-virginia-singer-to-produce-country-radio-single/article_8dc8b1ec-980d-11e6-a0a5-cf7ca4dd48a2.html|website=MurrayLedger.com|accessdate=October 22, 2016}}</ref>

A member of Baker's band, guitarist Thomas Estep, was killed in a drunk-driving indicent on January 1, 2017, when another vehicle crossed over the center line and collided with his vehicle on a Virginia highway.<ref>{{cite web|author=Griffith, Jessica|title=Friends remember 21-year-old bandmate killed in New Year's Day head-on collision|url=http://www.wcyb.com/news/virginia/russell-county/friends-remember-21-year-old-bandmate-killed-in-fatal-new-years-day-head-on-collision/243838697|website=WCYB.com|date=January 2, 2017|accessdate=January 2, 2017}}</ref> As a result of the crash, Baker partnered with [[Mothers Against Drunk Driving]] to perform at the annual MADD Law Enforcement Recognition Banquet in Southwest Virginia.<ref>{{cite web|title=Baker to Honor Thomas Estep|url=http://www.thecoalfieldprogress.com/coalfield_progress/entertainment/kaitlyn-baker-to-honor-thomas-estep/article_ecac939c-2ece-11e7-8cad-8327f5088f42.html|website=coalfield.com|accessdate=May 1, 2017}}</ref> She also announced that she was working on a new EP titled "Blackbird," which she planned to dedicate in Estep's memory.<ref>{{cite web|author=Lorge, Melinda|title=Here's how this emerging artist is paying tribute to her late bandmate|url=http://rarecountry.com/features/heres-how-this-emerging-country-artist-is-paying-tribute-to-her-late-bandmate/|website=RareCountry.com|date=September 19, 2017|accessdate=September 19, 2017}}</ref>

Baker released her EP "Blackbird" in April, 2018, with performances in [[Big Stone Gap]], Virginia, and [[Gate City, Virginia|Gate City]], Virginia. One song on the project, "Sassyfras Tea," was co-written by Baker and acclaimed country songwriters [[Tony Mullins]] and [[Larry Cordle]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Netherland, Tom|title=Budding Country Singer: Kaitlyn Baker sings like a 'Blackbird'|url=https://www.heraldcourier.com/community/columnists/netherland/budding-country-singer-kaitlyn-baker-sings-like-a-blackbird/article_9bf4204c-495c-11e8-9160-e75b454b6138.html|website=HeraldCourier.com|date=April 26, 2018 |accessdate=April 26, 2018}}</ref> The pop culture website ''[[BuzzFeed]]'' listed her among eleven "Badass Alternatives to Bro Country."<ref>{{cite web|author=Cills, Hazel|title=11 Badass Alternatives to Bro Country That You Need In Your Life|url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/hazelcills/not-bro-country|website=BuzzFeed.com|date=July 11, 2014 | accessdate=December 8, 2016}}</ref>

Notable appearances by Baker include Country Jam Colorado,<ref>{{cite web|author=Vinson, Christina|title=Country Jam's 2016 Daily Lineup Revealed |url=http://theboot.com/country-jam-2016-daily-lineup/|website=TheBoot.com|date=April 20, 2016 |accessdate=April 20, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Scott, Jason|title=Complete 2016 Country Jam Colorado lineup |url=https://www.axs.com/complete-2016-country-jam-colorado-daily-lineup-82026|website=axs.com|accessdate=April 20, 2016}}</ref> the [[Riverbend Festival]] in Chattanooga, Tennessee,<ref>{{cite web|title=Riverbend Festival 2017: Get to know Kaitlyn Baker |url=http://www.wrcbtv.com/story/35369851/riverbend-festival-2017-get-to-know-kaitlyn-baker
|website=wrcbtv.com|date=May 8, 2017
|accessdate=May 8, 2017}}</ref>  the [[Young Artist Awards]] in Los Angeles, California,<ref>{{cite web|title=Country singer Kaitlyn Baker to perform at Young Artist Awards in Studio City|url=http://tolucantimes.info/entertainment/country-singer-kaitlyn-baker-to-perform-at-young-artist-awards-in-studio-city/|website=TolucanTimes.info|accessdate=May 1, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151026111432/http://tolucantimes.info/entertainment/country-singer-kaitlyn-baker-to-perform-at-young-artist-awards-in-studio-city/|archive-date=October 26, 2015|url-status=dead}}</ref> the [[Findlay Market]] â€“ [[Cincinnati Reds]] Opening Day parade,<ref>{{cite web|title=Kaitlyn Baker to Appear in Cincinnati's Opening Day Parade |url=http://www.broadwayworld.com/cincinnati/article/Kaitlyn-Baker-to-Appear-in-Cincinnatis-Opening-Day-Parade-20160401|website=BroadwayWorld.com|accessdate=April 1, 2016}}</ref> and "[[Song of the Mountains]]", a nationally syndicated public television concert series.<ref>{{cite web|title=Boggs and Baker: Two girls from Pound to Perform on 'Song of the Mountains'|url=http://www.cybergrass.com/node/3709|website=Cybergrass.com|accessdate=June 3, 2014}}</ref> In concert, she has opened for popular artists including [[Craig Morgan]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Mark your calendar, 2017 Scarecrow Festival returns Sept. 15-17 |url=http://www.recordherald.com/news/16876/mark-your-calendar-the-2017-scarecrow-festival-returns-sept-15-17|website=RecordHerald.com|date=August 22, 2017|accessdate=August 22, 2017}}</ref> [[Jim Lauderdale]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Two time Grammy winning legend coming to Miamisburg |url=http://www.dayton.com/events/concerts/two-time-grammy-winning-legend-coming-miamisburg-brewery/yeiXAhIMr0lAlmOFgWzIeP/
|website=Dayton.com|accessdate=August 9, 2017}}</ref> [[Travis Tritt]], [[Billy Currington]], [[Chase Bryant]], [[Rhonda Vincent]], and others.{{Specify|reason=What concert? Who are the others?|date=February 2020}}
